thread.title: Some parents switch to religious exemption for vaccines
thread.title_full: Some parents switch to religious exemption for vaccines - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: WCAX News
title: Some parents switch to religious exemption for vaccines
text:
VERMONT - Some Vermonters may claim a religious exemption to getting their students vaccinated now that the state has eliminated the philosophical exemption.
Earlier this year, the state passed a law banning parents from opting out because they don't like the idea of vaccines. By law, students attending school must get a series of shots to guard against diseases.
But the religious exemption to vaccines is still in place, and that means parents can now choose that instead. Some school nurses have already reported hearing from families saying they're switching, which is just a matter of checking a different box on the form.
The law goes into effect July 1, 2016.
